instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
Hi, IÂ´m working on this board, was liquid damage

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>=8.58v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>=3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3.35V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>=5.15
L3095=0V
L7701=0V

Fan spin ok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
Do you get L7310/20 voltage?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

Where was the liquid spilled?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
L7310=1.8v
L7320=1.8v
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.35v
water around <CAPACITOR>C7841</CAPACITOR> but no corrosion, no damage around,only marks of dried water

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: Check for USB activity, on both ports.

threads.message: I checked it with thermal camera and found out that <CHIP>U4500</CHIP> got very hot 5 seconds after connected with the charger and no battery, should be replaced?, how I can check if this IC its ok?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: I put it all together and when i push the power button now it shows on the screen battery icon with low red battery at 20.13v and 0.047 A to 0.615 A and then its turn off and no green or yellow light on the charger

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: ok , I started in SMC bypass mode and the laptop start normally with the fan at max speed, and when I restarted  shows the same screen with the low battery sign,  so what do you suggest?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
20V power for an Air, why???
Don't you have original 45W Magsafe 2 charger?
It should work with 60/85W too, but none of them will send out 20V!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: I have one USB-C 85 w original apple charger and I use a USB-C tester with one T-tip adapter

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: also I have the original adapter for this mac but is the same results

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
Use original charger, or lab PSU with less than 18V; preferible 15-16V.
20V triggers <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL>.
This is the reason why machine starts in SMC bypass only.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: ok, I use now a 60W MacSafe2 and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>= 16.53v and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>=5.16v but no green or yellow light and shows the screen with the low battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
What is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?
Check it w/ and w/o battery connected.

Did you try known good LIO board/flex?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
changed the  LIO board/flex for a new one and Its work OK!!   the USB-C tester with one T-tip adapter from china sucks!
Men, you are the BEST! thank you very much!
